text: The Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine () is the highest body of state executive power in Ukraine and serves as the cabinet of government. Ministers have resigned (from the cabinet), as late as September 2024.https://www.kyivpost.com/post/38421. Retrieved 2024-09-04 It consists of the Prime Minister, the First Vice-Prime Minister, several Vice-Prime Ministers, the Minister of the Cabinet and many other Ministers, who head their assigned Ministries (departments). The Cabinet is steered by the Prime Minister, chosen from the parliament with the President's formal proposal. *The foreign minister is Andrii Sybiha (since 2024).https://yle.fi/uutiset/lyhyesti/74-20109694. Retrieved 2024-09-05 *Defence minister, Rustem Umerov (since 2024)https://www.kyivpost.com/post/38559. Retrieved 2024-09-06 *Finance minister, Serhiy Marchenko [as of 2025's second quarter].https://www.kyivpost.com/post/43092. Retrieved 2024-12-07 *Interior minister, Ihor Klymenko (as of 2025's second quarter)https://www.kyivpost.com/post/51102. Retrieved 2025-04-19 Minister of *Strategic Industries Herman Smetanin (since September 2024) *Culture and Strategic Communications Mykola Tochytsky (as of 2025's first quarter)https://www.kyivpost.com/post/44862 *National Unity, Oleksii Chernyshov "was presented as the ... minister" (in 2024); The (job or office) is supposed to help "Ukrainian refugees to return" to Ukraine.https://www.kyivpost.com/post/43252. Retrieved 2024-12-03 *Education, Oksen Lisovyi (as of 2025's second quarter); He is a former "sniper on the frontlinehttps://www.kyivpost.com/post/52929. Retrieved 2025-05-25". Former ministers: Defence minister Dmytro Kuleba resigned in September 2024.https://www.nettavisen.no/nyheter/ukrainas-utenriksminister-ber-om-a-fa- trekke-seg-ifolge-parlamentsleder/s/5-95-1999569. Retrieved 2024-09-04 As of 2008 there were 20 Ministries and 25 seats in the Cabinet. The Cabinet is responsible to the President of Ukraine and is under the control of and accountable to the Verkhovna Rada (Ukrainian parliament). == References == *
title: Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine
